oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-01-16 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 16, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Porter Wagoner (host/performer) with Joyce Paul, guest performers Johnnie & Jack, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Johnnie & Jack mention the next day's benefit for Red Sovine in Louisville, KY. It is announced that this is the 1058th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Porter Wagoner; Archie Campbell; Johnnie & Jack; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Porter Wagoner -- Settin' The Woods On Fire (Porter Wagoner) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Johnnie & Jack -- Sailor Man (Johnnie & Jack) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Porter Wagoner) -- Grant Turner introduces Tommy Jackson -- Grey Eagle (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner and Porter Wagoner talk -- I Thought Of God (Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Chet Atkins -- Villa (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Wagoner, Porter; Paul, Joyce (Vocalist); Johnnie & Jack; Wright, Johnnie, 1914-2011; Anglin, Jack, 1916-1963; Price, Ray, 1926-2013
